Fields.DialogueText: Huh. Saddlin' us up to move out to the wild frontier of the Pacific, huh?
Yep. We have our orders.
Any idea what it's like out there, Sheriff?

Fields.MenuText: It's a regular no man's land, Ari.
It's beautiful and deadly, like you, Ari.
We'll find out when we get there, Ari.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't see how there's anything regular about a no man's land, Sheriff.
Aw shucks, Sheriff!
Enemy spotted, Captain!
Everyone ready up for battle!
Roger, Sheriff!
@BATTLE
'Sides, it's an ocean, not a desert.
*ALARM*
What've we got?
Just a couple of varmints. Hopefully won't take too long...
@BATTLE
Nothing like a cold glass of water after a brisk fight with Morganas, eh, Sheriff?
Killing those vipers first thing in the morning is the best way to start the day.

Fields.MenuText: I'd rather eat a bowl of cereal, to be honest.
Swimming sounds like more, to be honest, Ari.
Want to go for a sprint around the deck to see?

Fields.DialogueText: Ha ha! The blood of our enemies does not rattle you up, Sheriff?
Is swimming fun?
Really, Sheriff? Best two out of three?
I'll just stick with milk but thank you.
Don't you do that everyday, Ari?
Not like you guys do, Sheriff.
We should try it sometime when we get to Hawaii.
I reckon that sounds like a good idea, Sheriff!
Loser has to sleep on the floor?
Heh heh! Better prepare for a sore back, Partner!
*ALARM*
Tarnation! An ambush! Tactic-using varmints are just plain cheating!
Keep up the artillery support!
Damn vultures! I'll show you who's a meal for for the birds!

Fields.MenuText: Keep it calm, Ari.
Let's kick their asses back to the abyss!
I think we should hightail out of here, Ari!

Fields.DialogueText: They keep flying around like literal flies, Sheriff! Or Mosquitos!
Roger dodger, Sheriff!
I don't think that's going to be an option, Cap.
Right. Be ready to fire on my order!
@BATTLE
We don't talk about mosquitos out here, Ari.
Right. It's a downright insult to the Morgana.
Hey, Sheriff? Looks like there's some unpleasantness between us and Pearl.
We can handle unpleasantness.
Heck, it's one of our specialties!
@BATTLE
Boy howdy! So, this is Hawaii, huh?
Last I checked.
The sun, the surf, and the pretty dames in the leaf skirts!

Fields.MenuText: Stop gawking at the girls, Ari, you'll make them nervous.
Do you want to wear the outfit, Ari?
Don't bug the locals, Ari. Belles might not be as well known out her-

Fields.DialogueText: That's beyond preposterous, Partner! Look! She gave me a flower necklace!
Naw. There's no way the outfit would look half as lovely on a gal like me, Sheriff.
Howdy! My name is Arizona! What's your name?
And now she's running for the hills...
Naw! She's just gonna holler to her friends to come on down!
With pitchforks, maybe...
So, you just like seeing OTHERS in the outfit then?
Look, Partner! I think this skirt is just your size!
I'll pass, Ari.
Aaaaaaaa!
C-Captain... I think I sustained c-critical damage just now...! *sniffs*
Come here and I'll hug you till you feel better.
*ALARM*
I sure as heck don't get it, Partner... Why do the locals run when I approach them?
I'm not carrying my equipment or anything that would make me look like a Belle...
You think it's my hat...?

Fields.MenuText: Your hat is quite frightening. Maybe they think you'll pluck the feathers from all their birds.
Give them some time to adjust, Arizona. Belles are new around here.
Maybe you should go swimming in battleship row, Ari.

Fields.DialogueText: T-tarnation, Captain, I'd never do that!
Right... It's just hard being a friendly gal who wants to make friends...
You're gonna have to fill me in on what exactly that will accomplish, Captain...
*ALARM*
Ah, damn. We need to get away from dock!
@BATTLE
Maybe they're afraid you'll steal their boots too.
Now I just know you're playing me for a fool, Partner!
Darn. Thought I could keep you going for a bit longer.
Chin up, Ari. You still got me.
That I do, Partner, that I do!
Maybe they'll find it amusing?
And we're right back from where we started... *sighs*
Now if I were a native to the island why would I turn tail and run from a walking battleship...?
Aaaaand there's my answer... *grumbles*
Miss Arizona has been taking this whole situation quite personally, Captain...

Fields.MenuText: You know Arizona, she'll get over this problem in no time.
Alert me the moment she even LOOKS like she gets an idea, Sailor!
I'm working on it right now. No need for concern.

Fields.DialogueText: Hopefully without force, Captain...
U-uhhh?!
Roger that, Captain. Last thing we wanna see is Miss Arizona upset over this...
@BATTLE
Last thing we need is for her to fall into depression because her crazy schemes do not work out.
R-roger, Captain...!
*ALARM*
And here's one kick to mix it up! Try to stop this ball!
Oooh! You got me! One point for you!
You're still leading by two points! I reckon I'll catch up soon!
Not till I get to ten points, Cowboy!

Fields.MenuText: You kids need a ref?
I have to watch this.
How about letting me in on the fun, eh?

Fields.DialogueText: Oh! It's a volunteer!
Oh! We have a spectator for our match!
All right! A new contender! What will you be betting, Captain?
Yay! Now I don't have to count!
You should still be practicing your numbers, Darlin'! And that's one more point for me!
That makes it... Five to six?
Correct! Good job!
You better watch me beat the battleship lady!
I reckon I'm still staking my honor on this match?
And an ice cream cone!
Gambling isn't something you should encourage, Ari!
It's just honor, Captain! One point for me!
She bet an ice cream cone that I couldn't beat her!
Hmm... I'll double her offer to TWO ice cream cones if we can team up to beat her!
You got a deal!
Consorting with the enemy, eh? I won't hold back!
Bring it, Ari!
We're under attack, Captain! Wake up!!
*BOOM*
I'm awake!
Thank ya kindly, Partner... But we best hurry to the bridge!
There's so many!
We'll be okay, Ari!
We will just have to swat them, won't we?!
A most satisfying swatting!
R-right...!!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
How're you holding up, Ari?
Not planning to sink anytime soon, Sheriff!
Good answer!
@BATTLE
Phew! Imagine if they actually hit us hard!
That'll teach the vultures to come knocking on our front door anytime soon!

Fields.MenuText: Are you absolutely sure that you're okay, Ari?
You put up a strong front, Ari. I appreciate what you do to keep morale up in times like this.
I'm going to put in a request for more anti-air fortifications at Pearl Harbor just in case the Morgana think about hitting us.

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I reckon we should lay at the beach for a bit when we get back.
I feel like I'm gonna fall to pieces, to be honest, Partner...
That it?
Yeah. This cowgirl needs a little nap away from everything...
I'll make sure we do just that then, Ari.
... You're honestly too kind, Partner...
Then we'll go on a date so we can both unwind. That sound fine?
That's all I could ever want at this moment... I'm lucky to have you, Captain.
You were really brave, Ari.
Aw shucks, Captain... You gone and made me cry...
Good thing it's just us two here, huh?
*sniffs* You're darn tootin'...!
What are we looking at?
I think it's just a couple of destroyers, Sheriff.
@BATTLE
Our father says that you're a liar!
Sis! That's rude!
Well, I'll be darn. So the first rumor about me is that I'm a white-collared liar!
Well, what specifically is she 'lying' about, Children?
My dad says that there's NOOO WAY a person can be a ship! It's impossible!

Fields.MenuText: Arizona, how about you lift your turrets for these non-believers, eh?
Arizona, how about you honk your horn for these non-believers, eh?
Eh. Why bother putting on a show for kids who lack imagination anyways?

Fields.DialogueText: Roger, Partner!
Optimizing sound levels to break the barrier, Captain!
Captain!
OOO! SEE! SEE! THEY'RE GOING UP!
The guys on the deck heard us talking so of course they're gonna lift the turrets!
Tarnation! Ain't you the little firecracker!
Oh boy. She found her next target for entertainment...
SOO LOOOOUDDDD!!
Ha! Someone is listening to us over the radio and honked the horn! No way she did it herself!
You got a point there, Darlin'! I guess it ain't easy proving that I'm a ship now ain't it?
I'm here to play kick ball! We gonna play or not?
Sign me up! First to get to ten points is the winner?
Loser buys popsicles!
You're on, Lady!
Listen here, you little-
Tarnation! You brought the ball back again! We gonna play some kickball to pass the time again?
Ha! You're better be ready to buy some popsicles, Lady! Cause I'm here to win!
Me too! Me too!
All righty! Don't get sour if you end up losing to a top-tier battleship, Darlins'!
Cause you can't back it up with facts! That's why she's a liar!
*ALARM*
Ha! Look over there, Sheriff!
Something inspirational, or... oh.
Target practice!
Never change, Ari.
@BATTLE
Ahh! It feels great to wrassle up them vipers after a long morning of no-shows!
It has me in a writin' mood, especially since I can read them to the kids when we get back to port!
You got any fun ideas, Sheriff?

Fields.MenuText: How bout a monster story?
How bout a story with time-traveling nuns?
How about a story with a talking pig in it?

Fields.DialogueText: Ooo! Like a monster protagonist? I haven't written that before!
Are ya'll just saying whatever comes to your head, Sheriff?
A pig that makes puns?
Cause I wrote that the last time. My version flopped hard.
I think it was our shoddy monster suit that made it hard to take the story seriously, Captain. Heh heh!
Besides, would the nuns be going to the past or the future because I don't think things would change much for them in the chapel.
Right...
Heh heh!
Is that a blanket statement?
Maybe when they fly! Heh heh!
*ALARM*
Sheriff? There's some ugly on fire coming our way.
This is an awful lot of activity way out here. I know we've never found a Pacific Morgana base, but...
Worry about it later, okay?
@BATTLE
Well, ain't this a holler! What brought all you kids to battleship row today?
To see the battleships, of course!
Not that we don't see them everyday though...
I reckon ya'll here to see the show me and the captain are ready to put on for ya, huh?
Yes, Miss Arizona!
All righty then! Let's get this show on the road!

Fields.MenuText: Oh how I long for sleep! The night is long and full of terrors!
Get off my lawn!
Today was the day the bay became a bagel!

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, Captain! May I offer my flute, for with but a tune the mice of sweet dreams shall chase away that which haunts thee?
Said the cranky old goat to the kids as they chewed up his patch of grass.
A bagel?
Mice? But will I dream of cheese?
Heh heh heh!
How dare you even think I would wish to share?!
'Nay!' said the kids to the old goat. 'You are old and will die an-', Captain?! Did you edit the script?!
Then what happened?! Did he die?!
T-that's not what I wrote! Captain!!
What's a 'bagel'?
Uh...
Oh boy... This punfest isn't going to work so well, Ari...
So a bagel is like a circular loaf of bread but portable?
Like cake?
This is going to take a while...
*ALARM*
Any idea what those aircraft carriers on the horizon are doing, Pilot?
They launched three scouting planes a while ago but nothing really else of note has happened, here's the coordinates of their last location.
Thank you for the information.
We gonna saddle up and bring the fight to them again, Partner?

Fields.MenuText: What do you think?
Command gets a say, but I'm pretty sure I know what the answer's going to be.
We'll be leading the charge!

Fields.DialogueText: We're not going to let them get the jump on us, that's for certain, Arizona.
As one of the Sheriffs of Pearl Harbor, I won't let them come stompin' into our turf like that, Partner! Those kids waiting for us at the docks...!
Let's get this rodeo on the road already then!
We'll give them a showdown like no other!
@BATTLE
So, you're out there chasing the bad guys, right?
Of course she is! She's the Sheriff! Just like we're her deputies!
Deputies-in-training, that is!
AH! Why do you get to wear her cool hat?!
Cause she put it on me first? Here! You try it on!

Fields.MenuText: Easy with the sticky fingers, kids. Don't go touching the feathers if you don't want Ari to pluck replacements from your island birds.
New deputies-in-training, huh? Looks like your hands are getting ever fuller by the minute, Ari.
Battleship row is lookin' to be in good hands if you kids think you're up to the task to join the 'Pearl Harbor Defense Force'!

Fields.DialogueText: Mhm! I made the hat myself.
Naw, Partner! It's much more fun to play cowboys with these tikes than rot on board the ship!
You've got that right, Cap!
That's so cool! Make me one sometime!
Me too! Me too!
Hmm... I'll think about it, All right?
All right, Miss Arizona!
Make sure to teach them properly how to identify hull types so they can pass the next test for their first badges.
We can earn badges?!
As captain of the Arizona, it would be an honor to see you children earn your badges for the first 'Pearl Harbor Defense Force' recruits!
No cheatin' by asking your Mas and Pas about which ship is which on test day, All right?
Yes, Ma'am!
A defense force?!
What's our job?!
Hmm... Well, you can start by learning what ships are which in the harbor!
Like which are destroyers and tug boats, for starters!
That boat is a tug, right?!
Correct! It helps tow the ships in and out of the harbor if they have trouble doing it by themselves!
Ooo! Tell us more!
Certainly!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Oh, hell. Ari, I'm my way to the bridge!
Your idea was wonderful, Partner! The local kids and their folks have been corralling around to the viewing area to look at the ships as of late!
Our two deputies have been informing locals and visitors alike on the ships in the harbor with such a spark!
Oh? Is that why people have been asking about the Arizona when I was in town today?
Tarnation! They're talkin' about me?!
Yeah... They think you're a strange girl.
Darn...!

Fields.MenuText: 'Better weird than feared', I'll say, Ari.
They're starting to warm up to you, Ari.
So, any idea on how we're gonna make the badges for our deputies for their first test? It's coming up soon, ain't it?

Fields.DialogueText: Shucks... I reckon you're right on that, Partner, but progress is slow, that's for certain.
I reckon it's better than them screaming and running away from me like I'm a wild boar...
Ah! One of the dock workers is a woodcarver from the mainland! I was thinking of commissioning him for two small badges we could pin on them.
*ALARM*
Man. Ain't that always the way?
@BATTLE
Keep your chin up, Ari. I'm with you every step of the way.
Many thanks, Captain!
They'll see you for you eventually. I know I did.
Heh heh. My charm's a quirky one, ain't it?
Metal is difficult to get since the war started with the Morganas and everyone is starting to ration...
We'll manage, Partner! Gotta be a misplaced bobby pin or two around somewhere on the ship!
I'll see if I can set up a donation jar or something in the barracks for loose stuff like that.
Where do these carriers keep coming from, Captain?!
We sink them and they come chargin' back!
The Morgana are tricky sons of bitches!
You think there's a nest of them farther out in the Pacific?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe.
Now's not the time for speculation.
You might be onto something.

Fields.DialogueText: We can explore that thought at a later time.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Get ready for the counter-attack!
Saddlin' up and ready to go!
That's all of them for now.
Captain. You reckon it might be worth sending a telegram to the Japanese to see what their eyes in the sky say?
It's an idea worth pursuing but there's no telling if they will work together with us on this matter or not.
Either way, I reckon we should have more surveillance just to be certain.
I agree with that entirely.
(talking to his mother) And that's a battleship like the Arizona!
You can tell because of the size and the huge turrets that none of the other ships have!
Correct! Which ship is a destroyer and which one is a light cruiser, other than size?
It should be the torpedos on it, right...?
Close, both light cruisers and destroyers have torpedos on them. Anything else that sets them apart?
Bigger guns and a larger tower?

Fields.MenuText: That's correct!
Good job!
A round of applause.

Fields.DialogueText: Excellent work, you two! I believe this concludes your first test, right, Ari?
Yer darn tootin', Captain! As a reward for passing your first test as junior Pearl Harbor Defense Force members, we present to you these badges of identification!
*gasps* Real badges?!
Mom, look! We got badges!
Looks like their parents are impressed by the tour and their children's knowledge, eh?
Mhm! Look at how happy they are! A job well done, I reckon!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Air Carriers again... The Morgana certainly lack creativity in their tactics.
It's a tactic that leads to less loss overall if we only take out the planes, Ari. Our naval force practices have shown the same results as well.
Seems like the age of gals like me is slowly coming to an end, huh?
You reckon I can get refit into a carrier sometime?

Fields.MenuText: Might not be a bad idea but it would be very expensive to convert you rather than build a new carrier from the ground up, Ari.
I like you the way you are now, Ari. You wouldn't be the gun slinging cowgirl I love if we redid you from the bottom up like that.

Fields.DialogueText: Ah... We'll it was just a silly idea anyways. I've heard how the Kaga and the Akagi from Japan have a lot of issues from being originally being battleships as well.
Even if this cowgirl is unable to ride into battle one day, you'll still find it in your heart to love her...?
*ALARM*
They just can't help killing a mood, can they?
@BATTLE
That still doesn't make you any less valuable to us because you can't launch planes, Ari.
Thank you for your kind words, Partner... I really needed to hear them...
Always.
Thank you, Partner...
So we're gonna help you make up a story today?!
I reckon we might give it a try, since the last reading didn't go so well.
It totally sucked.
That's rather harsh...
So what are some ideas you kids have?
A dragon story!
A story about Miss Peridot coming back to life!
Oooh! Maybe Miss Peridot fighting the bad guys on a dragon?!

Fields.MenuText: A dragon story sounds like fun!
How about the story where we bring Miss Peridot back?
I like the idea of a dragon-riding Miss Peridot!

Fields.DialogueText: Right! So, is our dragon a good dragon or mean dragon?
I reckon if it's just for us then we don't have to make it canon...
I know! It will be fun to write her in such an adventurous story!
A good dragon!
They light the bad king on fire and save the day!
How adventurous! Let's get started right away!
Miss Peridot is gonna carry a cannon?!
Ooo! Tell us more!
Settle down now, our hands can only move so fast!
Miss Peridot will use her sword to cut down the bad knight as her dragon flies by him!
Yeah! And then they save the kingdom together!
Such creative young minds! Better move our pens quicker, Ari!
Roger, Partner!
Kids, I need you to stay in the mess hall while the shooting's going on, okay? I promise, you'll be safe.
@BATTLE
Keep your eyes on the horizons, boys! The vultures will swoop in any minute now!
Yes, Ma'am!
The Morgana have a lot of guts pulling us away from our lessons with the kids today! Let's give them a rodeo they won't forget, Captain!
Roger that, Ari! Dust them!
@BATTLE
What in tarnation...?! Where are the planes?!
We received reports of planes heading in this direction...

Fields.MenuText: I'd say we scared them off after wrecking their frontliners so easily.
Let's head back to the harbor quickly to make sure these guys were just the frontrunners and not a decoy!
Might be a false positive on the air raid sirens, Ari. We've been on high alert lately so it was better safe than sorry.

Fields.DialogueText: I reckon I saw a plane or two in the distance but maybe those were just scouts?
Roger that, Captain! Full speed back to port!
Oh good... I reckon I would have had a heart attack if these jokers were just a decoy.
That sounds probable. Better safe than sorry when dealing with the Morgana.
I radioed in and got the all clear signal from the radio tower, Miss Arizona.
Oh! Thank goodness! I was worried there for a moment...
Thank you for that quick thinking, Sailor. Keep the com link open in case things change.
Roger, Captain!
I had our comm team check in at the island and everything seems to be normal.
I won't let my guard down, even for a moment, Partner.
Don't go swatting at every shadow you see moving though, All right?
Roger that, Captain!
Sheriff?
I see 'em.
Get to stations, people. I don't think they're going to run away from us just yet.
@BATTLE
Phew. Quite the busy days we've been having, right?
It's nice to be able to enjoy a drink with you like this, Partner.

Fields.MenuText: Not ideal but it is what it is, eh?
I should treat you to a real date next time rather than just sitting on the deck, Ari.
Being with you calms me even in the most stressful of situations, Arizona.

Fields.DialogueText: I reckon that we make the best of what we got.
Sometimes, it's nice to just let the cool island breeze run through your hair as you unwind, Captain.
I reckon I feel similar on that matter, Captain.
Would it be all right If I rest my head against your shoulder?
I'll hold onto your hat while you get some rest, Ari.
I'm glad that anywhere I am, there you'll be, Partner...
Mmm.
Please don't tell me that suitcase is full of laundered money, Captain...
Heh.
Heh heh! Shucks!
So, is that new orders from high command or something?
No. It's... don't laugh.
Cross my heart and hope to die.
It's about Hawaiian real estate, more or less.
I've just been wondering how hard it would be to build a little house on the coast. Close enough to the water so someone - hypothetically - bound to a ship could maybe get some peace once in a while.
Partner, that's...
Yeah. Kinda. Sweet though.
I mean, why would I want peace when I got you?
Oh, I mean, I would come with the house.
I smell a bargain!
Not too shabby, eh?
You're kinda sweet, you know? You...
*ALARM*
Oh, tarnation!
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Nuts?
Impressively forward thinking?
Just humor me, okay?

Fields.DialogueText: Well, I don't know about that.
I just kinda question your assumptions.
No. Sorry.
Stop running, ya cowards! Stop sending your vultures to peck at us!!
Keep your head cool, Arizona.
I'm gonna hogtie and skin them when we catch them, Captain!
Captain! We're in firing range of their escorts!
Open fire!!
YEEE HAW!!
@BATTLE
We'll close the gap between us and those Morganas sooner than you think!
These guns are burning red for their blood!
Welcome home!
Welcome home, Miss Arizona!
*gasp*
I think you two short circuited her... Might want to give her a hug to fix her right up.
Yay!
Oh no! I'm going down!

Fields.MenuText: Make some room for me. The captain always goes down with their ship, after all!
I'm in the mood for raiding a popsicle stand. Anyone else interested?
Who's up for a game of soccer? I know I am!

Fields.DialogueText: Haha!
Me! Me!
Me! I'll beat you this time, Captain!
*ALARM*
Perfect timing.
@BATTLE
Heh heh! Never thought I'd hear a pleasant twist on that saying from you, Partner!
Maybe saying it like that will give the words new power.
I see! Let us hope that it comes true for the future to come!
I want one too, Captain!
Make sure you get along quickly now! Don't keep us waiting!
Roger that, Sheriff!
Not if I beat the captain first!
Better get along now and get the ball before the sun goes down, you two!
Roger that, Miss Arizona!
*ALARM*
This should be it. The last dregs of the Morgana group.
I know, I know. I should be happy - and I am!
But I'm gonna miss these waters.
Well, let's make sure they're safe first.
Point.
@BATTLE
Taking it all in one last time before we leave, Arizona?
Yeah... I know we can come back, but this cowgirl was getting used to docking at Battleship Row.
And the kids...
You'll write to them. You're good at that.
Pfff.
And I think we will come back. I'm sure the Morganas aren't done with this part of the world.
Plus you gotta build me that beach house, right?
Or, we could build something that floats and you could just tow it behind you wherever we go.
Not your most practical plan.
Yeah, but we turn out to be really good at the impractical ones, so I thought I'd throw it out there.
What?
How did I get lucky enough to find you, you goober?
I don't know. But I'm really glad you did.
